inlineContent.text: The detection result is visualized using a polygonal bezier path.
This class cannot be instanced from a storyboard.
Instead it is installing itself as a child view controller onto a given parent view controller.
, it benefits from all its advantages, e.g. zooming, view finder, and energy management.

abstract.text: A UIViewController subclass to show a camera screen and run a user guiding document detector.
Version: 6.0.0
Whether the document capturing is animated or not.
The auto-snapping mode.
A UIViewController subclass to show a camera screen and run a user guiding document detector.
Initializes an instance of this class with the default configuration.
Whether the polygon-displaying layer is hidden or not.
The mode of the document detector to be used for document outline detection.
Captures the currently detected document image, as if the user would press the shutter button or the auto-snapping fires.
Whether the snap button is hidden or not.
Sets a custom snapping button. If not
, it replaces the default snapping button.
The configuration object for the document detection status text.
A highly customizable camera view controller that delivers a basic camera functionality along with video
frame extraction and preprocessing, orientation correction and still image capturing.
The  delegate protocol for
The default snap button.
Installs the receiver as child view controller onto the parent view controllers view using its entire bounds area.
Limits the maximum size of the document image.
The sensitivity of auto-snapping. Values are clamped to the range 0.0 - 1.0.
The configuration for the polygon displayed over the detected document when the document detection status is not
If set to
the polygon layer is always shown, if there was a document polygon detected.
Otherwise it is hidden.
The configuration for the progress polygon displayed over the detected document when the document is being scanned in auto snapping mode.
The delegate of the receiver.
If set to
, the documents aspect ratio is not compared to the screens aspect ratio, the bad aspect ratio warning will never appear.
The minimum size in percent (0 - 100) of the screen size to accept a detected document.
It is sufficient that height or width match the score.
The configuration for the polygon displayed over the detected document when the document detection status is
A document has been detected successfully.
The delegate protocol for the
class.
The required aspect ratios for the document detector.
A
subclass to display a view finder with colored background and transparent cutout with the given aspect ratio.
Whether the receiver is currently animating a captured document or not. Readonly.
If set to
the detection status label is always shown, if its text is non-empty.
Otherwise it is hidden.
The minimum score in percent (0 - 100) of the perspective distortion to accept a detected document.
The filters to be applied to the snapped document image.
The brightness threshold to accept a detected document in the range of 0 (very dark) to 255 (very bright).
If  the average brightness value of the detectors input image is below this value, the status of the detection will be set to
The scaling factor for captured images. Values are clamped to the range 0.0 - 1.0.
A multicast-oberserver protocol that informs its oberservers about state changes of a camera session.
The font size of the user guidance label.
The minimum delay in seconds between two consecutive automatic image captures.
The preferred aspect ratios for the document detector.
